chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis S. Cline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing after Revocation in 14cf57 and 14cf106 and Initial Appearance/Sentencing in 15cf90.

02:42 pm - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf57 (SEHR), 14cf106 (SEHR) and 15CF90 (AIA).  In 15cf90 - Richards in receipt of complaint, waive reading - will waive preliminary hearing.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State moves dismiss but read in counts 2 and 3.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Richards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.

10:47 am - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf57, 14cf106 and 14cf115.  In case 14cf106 - State stipulates defendant returned vehicle within 24 hours undamaged.  State moves to amend Count 1 to a Class A Misdemeanor and Dismiss but read in count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1 and 3.  In case 14cf115 - State moves to Dismiss but read in Count 3 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
